citations.narrative:
There was an excessive accumulation of a brown film of organic matter dusted with white powder coating the inside walls
of a plastic storage tub used for dog food storage. It is not known when this tub was last cleaned and sanitized. Residues
accumulating in food storage receptacles may be a source of spoiling, contamination, or spread of disease from food fed
to the regulated animals. The licensee must ensure that food receptacles be cleaned as often as needed to prevent
accumulation of debris, food waste, etc. Correct by: May 22, 2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
All of the enclosures in the indoor housing facility have an excessive accumulation of hair wrapped around wires of the
paneling. This organic debris hangs approximately 2" from the bottom of the wires. Accumulation of organic debris can
harbor disease agents which the regulated animals may come into contact with. It can also be a fire hazard, attract
insects, and/or emit odors. The licensee must clean the primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent the
accumulation of hair and other debris in order to reduce diseases, hazards, insects, and odors. Correct by: May 22, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.9(b) 
   
Feeding 
There was an excessive accumulation of a brown film of organic matter dusted with white powder coating the inside walls 
of a plastic storage tub used for dog food storage.  It is not known when this tub was last cleaned and sanitized. Residues 
accumulating in food storage receptacles may be a source of spoiling, contamination, or spread of disease from food fed 
to the regulated animals. The licensee must ensure that food receptacles be cleaned as often as needed to prevent 
accumulation of debris, food waste, etc. Correct by: May 22, 2023. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
All of the enclosures in the indoor housing facility have an excessive accumulation of hair wrapped around wires of the 
paneling. This organic debris hangs approximately 2" from the bottom of the wires. Accumulation of organic debris can 
harbor disease agents which the regulated animals may come into contact with. It can also be a fire hazard, attract 
insects, and/or emit odors. The licensee must clean the primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent the 
accumulation of hair and other debris in order to reduce diseases, hazards, insects, and odors. Correct by: May 22, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
